001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import java.awt.Point;
004import squidpony.squidmath.Point3D;
005import squidpony.squidmath.RNG;
006
007/**
008 * Basic radius strategy implementations likely to be used for roguelikes.
009 *
010 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
011 */
012public enum Radius {
013
014    /**
015     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a square.
016     *
017     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
018     * movement scheme with no additional cost for diagonal movement.
019     */
020    SQUARE,
021    /**
022     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a diamond.
023     *
024     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in a 4-way
025     * movement scheme.
026     */
027    DIAMOND,
028    /**
029     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a circle.
030     *
031     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
032     * movement scheme with all movement cost the same based on distance from
033     * the source
034     */
035    CIRCLE,
036    /**
037     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a cube.
038     *
039     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
040     * movement scheme with no additional cost for diagonal movement.
041     */
042    CUBE,
043    /**
044     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a octahedron.
045     *
046     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in a 4-way
047     * movement scheme.
048     */
049    OCTAHEDRON,
050    /**
051     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a sphere.
052     *
053     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
054     * movement scheme with all movement cost the same based on distance from
055     * the source
056     */
057    SPHERE;
058
059    private static RNG rng = null;//lazy instantiation
060
061    public double radius(int startx, int starty, int startz, int endx, int endy, int endz) {
062        return radius((double) startx, (double) starty, (double) startz, (double) endx, (double) endy, (double) endz);
063    }
064
065    public double radius(double startx, double starty, double startz, double endx, double endy, double endz) {
066        double dx = Math.abs(startx - endx);
067        double dy = Math.abs(starty - endy);
068        double dz = Math.abs(startz - endz);
069        return radius(dx, dy, dz);
070    }
071
072    public double radius(int dx, int dy, int dz) {
073        return radius((float) dx, (float) dy, (float) dz);
074    }
075
076    public double radius(double dx, double dy, double dz) {
077        dx = Math.abs(dx);
078        dy = Math.abs(dy);
079        dz = Math.abs(dz);
080        double radius = 0;
081        switch (this) {
082            case SQUARE:
083            case CUBE:
084                radius = Math.max(dx, Math.max(dy, dz));//radius is longest axial distance
085                break;
086            case DIAMOND:
087            case OCTAHEDRON:
088                radius = dx + dy + dz;//radius is the manhattan distance
089                break;
090            case CIRCLE:
091            case SPHERE:
092                radius = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy + dz * dz);//standard spherical radius
093        }
094        return radius;
095    }
096
097    public double radius(int startx, int starty, int endx, int endy) {
098        return radius((double) startx, (double) starty, (double) endx, (double) endy);
099    }
100
101    public double radius(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
102        double dx = Math.abs(startx - endx);
103        double dy = Math.abs(starty - endy);
104        return radius(dx, dy);
105    }
106
107    public double radius(int dx, int dy) {
108        return radius((double) dx, (double) dy);
109    }
110
111    public double radius(double dx, double dy) {
112        return radius(dx, dy, 0);
113    }
114
115    public Point onUnitShape(double distance) {
116        if (rng == null) {
117            rng = new RNG();
118        }
119
120        int x = 0, y = 0;
121        switch (this) {
122            case SQUARE:
123            case CUBE:
124                x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
125                y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
126                break;
127            case DIAMOND:
128            case OCTAHEDRON:
129                x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
130                y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
131                if (radius(x, y) > distance) {
132                    if (x > 0) {
133                        if (y > 0) {
134                            x = (int) (distance - x);
135                            y = (int) (distance - y);
136                        } else {
137                            x = (int) (distance - x);
138                            y = (int) (-distance - y);
139                        }
140                    } else {
141                        if (y > 0) {
142                            x = (int) (-distance - x);
143                            y = (int) (distance - y);
144                        } else {
145                            x = (int) (-distance - x);
146                            y = (int) (-distance - y);
147                        }
148                    }
149                }
150                break;
151            case CIRCLE:
152            case SPHERE:
153                double radius = distance * Math.sqrt(rng.between(0.0, 1.0));
154                double theta = rng.between(0, 2 * Math.PI);
155                x = (int) (Math.cos(theta) * radius);
156                y = (int) (Math.sin(theta) * radius);
157        }
158
159        return new Point(x, y);
160    }
161
162    public Point3D onUnitShape3D(double distance) {
163        if (rng == null) {
164            rng = new RNG();
165        }
166
167        int x = 0, y = 0, z = 0;
168        switch (this) {
169            case SQUARE:
170            case DIAMOND:
171            case CIRCLE:
172                Point p = onUnitShape(distance);
173                return new Point3D(p.x, p.y, 0);//2D strategies
174            case CUBE:
175                x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
176                y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
177                z = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
178                break;
179            case OCTAHEDRON:
180            case SPHERE:
181                do {
182                    x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
183                    y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
184                    z = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
185                } while (radius(x, y, z) > distance);
186        }
187
188        return new Point3D(x, y, z);
189    }
190}
